intro: Rajania prestoniensis, commonly known as the Preston's Rajania, is a rare flowering plant native to the highlands of Ecuador. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
